newsitem.title: DUBAI: PRESS DIGEST - United Arab Emirates - Oct 27.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - United Arab Emirates - Oct 27.

text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the United Arab Emirates press on Sunday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- UAE President Sheikh Zaid receives telephone call from King Juan Carlon of Spain.
- U.S. official warns of cycle of violence (in region).
- Bahrain to attend (Gulf Cooperation Council) summit. Manama's decision follows efforts exerted by Saudi Arabia - sources.
- Visa transfer rules relaxed again. Change of sponsor allowed after seven months.

- Abu Dhabi Crown Prince Sheikh Khalifa bin Zaid meets Robert Pelletreau, U.S. Assistant Secretary of State for Near Eastern Affairs. UAE stresses need for American pressure on Israel. Pelletreau says French efforts will help to achieve peace.
- UAE and France in joint war games.
- Dubai municipality to set up new building.
- Emirates airline stops flights to Vietnam.
- Khalifa and Pelletreau review bilateral ties and joint cooperation.
- GCC information ministers end meeting in Riyadh and warn against practices by biased media "that distort facts".
- Sheikh Zaid gets telephone call from King Fahd of Saudi Arabia.
- Joint war games with France enter third stage.
